data.event: The county was created on December 5, 1811.

event.title: was organized under act of General Assembly of Georgia, December 11, 1811

data.event: Named for James Madison, fourth president of United States, from 1809 to 1817, Madison County, was organized under act of General Assembly of Georgia, December 11, 1811.

event.title: were heavily damaged by the cotton monoculture common in this region prior to the 1930s

data.event: The soils of Madison County were heavily damaged by the cotton monoculture common in this region prior to the 1930s.
The bridge, which is over 100 years old, spans 229 feet of the South Fork of the Broad River.
